Problem:
Analyze the behavior of a system under a specific transformation, where \( z(t) \) represents a complex function of time \( t \) defined by \( z(t) = e^{i\omega t}z_0 \), with \( \omega \) constant. The Laplace transform \( \mathcal{L}\{z(t)\} \) is utilized to study the system's frequency domain characteristics.

If \( \mathcal{L}\{z(t)\} \) is computed without any modification to \( z(t) \), will the Laplace transform domain reflect simple oscillatory behavior of \( z_0 \) across all frequencies?
Explanation: The direct computation of \( \mathcal{L}\{z(t)\} \) reveals a pole at \( s = -i\omega \), corresponding precisely to the frequency \( \omega \) of the original oscillation of \( z_0 \). This reflects the undisturbed oscillatory nature of \( z_0 \) in the Laplace domain.
